definitions.definition: ( transitive , British , criminal slang ) To obtain (something) through armed robbery or robbery involving violence , or theft ; to rob ; to steal .

main_definition: ( transitive , British , criminal slang ) To obtain (something) through armed robbery or robbery involving violence , or theft ; to rob ; to steal .

subdefinitions.definition: To obtain (something) for free , particularly by guile or persuasion . ( specifically ) To obtain ( confidential information ) by impersonation or other deception ; also, to deceive (someone) into disclosing confidential information.
examples: He’s blagged his way into many a party.
The newspaper is accused of blagging details of the prime minister’s flat purchase from his solicitors.

subdefinitions.definition: To obtain (something desired ), or avoid (something undesired ), through improvisation or luck ; to fluke , to get away with .
To use guile or persuasion on (someone); also, to deceive or perpetrate a hoax on (someone).
To meet and seduce (someone) for romantic purposes , especially in a social situation ; to pick up .

definitions.definition: To speak persuasively or with guile to obtain something.

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To speak persuasively or with guile to obtain something.
